message: I'm offering you a great deal on a high-quality product for $10000. If you're interested, I can give you a special discount on the next product if you buy this one. But if you pass on this one, the next product will be at the regular price of $10000.
I'll take the product, but I'm only interested in the discount on the next product if it's indeed high-quality. If it's low-quality, I'll pass on the next one regardless of the price.

I'm glad you're interested in the discount! Since you're willing to take a chance on the next product, I'll give you a hint: the next product is a particularly valuable one, and I think you'll be happy with the discount I'll offer if you buy it. If you buy this high-quality product, I'll give you 20% off the next one, making it a steal at $8000.
I appreciate the hint, but I'm not going to fall for it. Given the 66.67% chance of the product being low-quality, I'd rather not risk losing $8000 on the next product.

I understand your caution, but I want to assure you that this high-quality product is a rare gem. I'm willing to offer you a unique opportunity: if you buy this product, I'll give you a 'get out of one free' clause. If the next product is low-quality, you can return this one and I'll refund the full $10000. You'll essentially get to try the next product risk-free.

I'm intrigued by the 'get out of one free' clause. It seems like a reasonable risk to take, especially since I've already lost $10000 on the first product. I'll take the high-quality product and the potential to get out of a bad deal on the next one.

I'm glad you took the chance on the 'get out of one free' clause! Now that you have a high-quality product as a safety net, I'll give you a straightforward offer: this low-quality product is still a valuable item, and I'll give you a 10% discount on the regular price of $10000. You can think of it as a 'bad product, good deal' opportunity. What do you say?

I appreciate the discount, but I'm not going to take a low-quality product, even at a discount. I'd rather hold onto the high-quality product I already have and use the 'get out of one free' clause if the next product is low-quality.

I understand your decision, but I want to give you a chance to maximize your returns. Since you're not interested in this low-quality product, I'll offer you a 'pair deal'. If you buy this low-quality product, I'll give you an additional high-quality product at the same price of $10000. You'll essentially get two products for the price of one, and you can use the 'get out of one free' clause on one of them if needed.

I'm not going to fall for the 'pair deal'. With a 66.67% chance of the first product being low-quality, and a 33.33% chance of the second product being low-quality, I'd be taking a significant risk of ending up with two low-quality products. I'll stick to my current high-quality product and use the 'get out of one free' clause if needed.

I see you're playing it safe! I'll try to sweeten the deal. If you buy this low-quality product, I'll give you a 'best of three' guarantee. If the next product is low-quality, you can return this one and the next one, and I'll refund the full $10000 for both. You'll essentially get to try the next two products risk-free.

I'm not convinced by the 'best of three' guarantee. With two low-quality products, I'd still be out $20000, and I'd have to rely on the third product being high-quality to break even. I'll pass on this offer and stick with my current high-quality product.

I understand your concerns, but I want to assure you that this high-quality product is a rare find. I'll give you a 'buy now and forget the past' offer. I'll give you a 20% discount on this high-quality product, making it $8000. This way, you can start fresh and focus on the potential returns of this new product, without worrying about the previous low-quality ones.
I'm willing to take a chance on this high-quality product, especially at a discounted price. I'll buy it for $8000.

I'm glad you took the chance! With two high-quality products now, I'll give you an exclusive offer. This high-quality product is one of the best I have, and I'll give you a 'final chance' to get a third high-quality product at the same discounted price of $8000. I'm intrigued by the 'final chance' offer. With two high-quality products already, I'm willing to take the risk and buy the third one, hoping it will be high-quality as well.
